intro: Eupatorium pseudofastigiatum var. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf boneset, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many familiar flowering plants. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and native garden cultivation.
